column4: DasEi and ubottu - yes i was reading up on GRUB. but i cam across this statement: The basic concept involves partitioning a disk, to accommodate each planned installation, including separate partitions for data storage or backups. The partitions should be done with a Windows partitioning tool (diskpart, Disk Management), rather than a Linux tool (parted, QTparted), for the simple reason that Windows is more particular (cf. "picky") about
Why use a windows tool to partition a disk, the linux ones are fine if not better. This only matters if you have a ssd
